intro: Eriolopha platylopha, commonly known as the flat-leafed eriolopha, is a species of moth found in various regions of the world. It belongs to the family Gelechiidae, which includes small, often cryptic moths. The plant is characterized by its flat, broad leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often in temperate forests. The leaves serve as a host for the larvae of this moth, which feed on the foliage.
